body:
Hi,

I'm not sure the issue is of sqlalchemy in this case, since at that point sqlalchemy is just calling asyncpg.
Can you reproduce the issue using asyncpg directly?

this seems likely to be related to asyncpgs [type cache](https://magicstack.github.io/asyncpg/current/api/index.html#asyncpg.connection.Connection.reload_schema_state) architecture, which emits a query (which might be something like [this one](https://github.com/cockroachdb/cockroach/issues/71908#issuecomment-951320600) ) to gain information about composed types on the server.  it would have to do this per-connection as this information isn't shared.   the issue has been reported before as seen in https://github.com/MagicStack/asyncpg/issues/727 , there's a suggestion to disable a "jit" in postgresql that might help.

overall this is external driver issue.

I confirm that this happens with asyncpg directly and that turning postgresql jit off avoid the issue. 
As you both suggested, this is an external driver issue.
Thanks for the quick answer guys.

Here is how to turn off jit in postgresql with SQLAlchemy:
```python
engine = create_async_engine(
    "postgresql+asyncpg://user:password@localhost/tmp",
    connect_args={"server_settings": {"jit": "off"}},
)
```

Ok, thanks for debugging it.

Maybe try using the normal postgres image, not `postgres:alpine`
If this can be set on the client side like that we might want to put a note in the docs
I wonder if this is only an alpine thing or if it affects also the normal debian-based docker (or installs in other linux distributions - os)
I can confirm that the behavior is the same with docker image postgres (version 14.0 (Debian 14.0-1.pgdg110+1)) and postgres:alpine

repository.name: pytest-pg
repository.description: A tiny plugin for pytest which runs PostgreSQL in Docker
